definition: to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion

sentences.english: In old society many talented young people were too often ploughed under.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會許多有才幹的青年常被埋沒。

sentences.english: Faultfinding is one talent that ought to be buried.
sentences.chinese: 吹毛求疵是人們必須埋沒的一個才幹。

sentences.english: The mud-rock flow submerged the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 泥石流埋沒了整個村莊。

sentences.english: Workers should avoid 'hiding themselves' at work, he says.
sentences.chinese: 加芬克爾稱，員工應該避免“把自己埋沒在”工作中。

sentences.english: This shirt I found in the store is a real diamond in the rough.
sentences.chinese: 我在店裏找到的那件襯衫真是被埋沒了的好貨。

sentences.english: Huge rockslides at times bury bulldozers and other machines.
sentences.chinese: 有時候巨大岩石崩落埋沒了壓路機及其他機器。

sentences.english: The faster player was no longer rushing to bury their neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 速度較快的參與者也不再急於將鄰居埋沒。

sentences.english: Secretarial work is a waste of her talent.
sentences.chinese: 做祕書是在埋沒她的才能。

sentences.english: History is a funny animal. People can get lost in the mists of time.
sentences.chinese: 歷史是個有趣的活物，會將人物埋沒於時間的迷霧中。

definition: to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
too busy/to have no time for/fully occupied
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
